intro: Zannichellia melitensis, commonly known as the Maltese water plant, is a species of aquatic plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. The plant has slender, ribbon-like leaves that are often submerged, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually found in water. Zannichellia melitensis is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels and can thrive in both still and gently flowing water environments. Its presence is an indicator of good water quality in its native ecosystems.
